sec.title: AADE’s DEAP Offers Accreditation for Your DSME/T Program
sec.p: AADE provides accreditation for Diabetes Self-Management Education programs through DEAP (Diabetes Education Accreditation Program). Accrediting your program brings quality, trust, confidence, and the additional benefit of reimbursement eligibility by Medicare and other insurance providers.

Only AADE is solely dedicated to supporting educators who provide diabetes self-management training. The AADE DEAP team provides excellent customer support throughout the application process. Applicants do not need to be CDE certified, but teaching in your accredited program does count toward CDE and BC-ADM practice hours. Our online application process allows you to stop and start your application as needed. All required documents can be uploaded at your convenience. You only need to fill out one application for your program, even if you have multiple sites.

AADE’s simple fee structure includes up to 10 sites for only $800 and 11 to 20 sites for only $1200. If you have more than 20 locations, contact the DEAP program at 800.338.3633 for more information and pricing.
Visit us online at http://www.diabeteseducator.org/deap3 for more information and an online application. Or send questions to DEAP@AADENET.ORG.

sec.title: BC-ADM Exam Now Available
sec.p: AADE is accepting applications to sit for the Board Certified-Advanced Diabetes Management (BC-ADM) Exam. Becoming a BC-ADM is a great achievement for diabetes educators with an advanced degree in their field and a professional license. The scope of advanced diabetes practice includes patient management skills such as medication adjustment, medical nutrition therapy, exercise planning, and counseling for behavior management and psychosocial issues. Attaining optimal metabolic control in the diabetic client may include treatment and monitoring of acute and chronic complications. The depth of knowledge and competence in advanced clinical practice and diabetes skills affords an increased complexity of decision making that expands the traditional disciplines’ specific practice. Research, mentoring, and continuing professional development are expected skill sets.
Applications are accepted on a continual basis. In 2011 over 100 new candidates sat for the exam. The examination is offered during 1-month windows following the application’s approval.
Candidates are strongly encouraged to complete their applications at least 60 days prior to their desired testing date. There are two testing windows per year—June and December:

On Saturday, August 4, from 8:00 am to 12:00 pm, the 4-hour “Advanced Reimbursement Course” will focus on advanced topics in reimbursement and drill down into how to maximize reimbursement across all practice models, for group visits, KDE, CGM, and telehealth, featuring case studies. sec.title: Learn Advanced Management for Hospital Patients With Diabetes
sec.p: One of three new advanced courses, the Advanced Inpatient Diabetes Management course is an advanced self-paced, 4-module online course that focuses on the art and science of caring for patients with hyperglycemia and/or diabetes in the hospital setting. Those who complete the course will earn 4 CE credits.
Learning Modules include:

list-item.p: Module 2: Non-Critical Care Setting: Insulin Therapy
Module 3: Meeting Glycemic Targets in Non-Critical Care Setting: Barriers and Possible Solutions
Module 4: Special Considerations in Acute Care.

sec.p: This and other online courses on Gestational Diabetes (4 CE) and CGM (12 CE) are available any time. Register and learn more at www.diabeteseducator.org/advanced4.

sec.title: CORE Concepts Now Available Live and Online
sec.p: AADE is pleased to offer this valuable resource in two formats, so you can choose the learning method that is best for you.

sec.title: New 8-week online course
sec.p: AADE’s popular CORE Concepts Course is now available as an 8-week online course. You will be able to earn more than 20 hours of CE credit at times that fit your schedule.

An instructor will post lessons and required readings once per week during the course. The Art and Science of Diabetes Self-Management Education Desk Reference: 2nd Edition is the required text for the class. After completing the readings, students will answer instructor questions in the discussion forum and take an online test about the week’s lesson. At the end of the 8-week course, students will be tested on their knowledge of the overall course. Grades will be based on the final test as well as participation in the discussion forums.
The courses will be available two more times in 2012:

sec.title: Three-day live course
sec.p: The original, 3-day live course has been updated with expanded topics for 2012. In addition to over 20 CE, the live courses feature the chance to network with health care professionals from around the nation. They will be held 2 more times in 2012:

The interactive nature of the CORE Concepts® course is one of its most valuable aspects. Both versions of the course are facilitated by a multidisciplinary team of registered health care professionals, including a nurse, dietitian, and pharmacist. Case studies are used throughout the course allowing for discussion and sharing of knowledge among participants.

You can save $30 on a 1-year AADE membership when you join or renew and register for either version of the Core Concepts Course. For more information about the online course, visit www.diabeteseducator.org/core3. For more information about the live course, visit www.diabeteseducator.org/ccc8.

sec.title: Introduce Your Team to the ABCs of Diabetes Education
sec.p: If you work on a team with non–diabetes educator clinicians who want to enhance their ability to work with patients with diabetes, AADE has developed an online course that can help them reach their goal. Nurses, dietitians, and generalist pharmacists should consider this interactive course as one of the first steps toward becoming a diabetes educator.
ABCs of Diabetes Education is a self-paced, 6-module online course that focuses on the essential knowledge and skills these clinicians will need. Each module in this self-paced course includes:

list-item.p: Video vignettes presenting a clinical situation relevant to each module
Virtual case study discussions to illustrate the contributions of each member of the multidisciplinary team

sec.p: For more information and to register, visit www.diabeteseducator.org/abc7.
